intro: Hieracium murorum subsp. subfarreilimbatum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hawkweed, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and yellow composite flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The subspecies is distinguished by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and a hairy stem. It is typically found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. This plant is native to parts of Europe and has been introduced to other regions, often thriving in disturbed environments.
